document.heading: District of Columbia Uniform Controlled Substances Act of 1981

history.narrative: Law 4-29, the “District of Columbia Uniform Controlled Substances Act of 1981,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 4-123, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 5, 1981, and May 19, 1981, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 9, 1981, it was assigned Act No. 4-51 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
